alert.note: Alert for Bee; Inland Nueces; Inland San Patricio; Jim Wells; Live Oak (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 13 at 5:13AM CDT by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...An area of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Nueces, western San Patricio, northeastern Jim Wells, southeastern Live Oak and southeastern Bee Counties through 615 AM CDT... At 510 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking an area of strong thunderstorms across western San Patricio County, slowly drifting towards the northeast. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mathis, Skidmore, Odem, St. Paul, Lake City, San Patricio, Edroy, Bluntzer, Tynan, Sandia, West Sinton, Argenta, Papalote, Calallen, Lakeside and Lake Corpus Christi. This includes the following highways... Interstate 37 between mile markers 14 and 41. US Highway 181 between mile markers 596 and 614. US Highway 59 near mile marker 702. US Highway 77 between mile markers 654 and 658. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Bee; Inland Nueces; Inland San Patricio; Jim Wells; Live Oak
